ADOPTING ORDINANCE
AN ORDINANCE ADOPTING THE
LAKE ZURICH MUNICIPAL CODE
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE VILLAGE OF LAKE ZURICH, LAKE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, as follows:
SECTION I. Findings and Determinations. It is hereby found and determined that, in order to provide for health, safety and welfare of the citizenry served
by the Village of Lake Zurich, it is necessary and convenient to review, amend, establish and adopt a Lake Zurich Municipal Code for the regulation and
control of those activities, structures, uses and other matters all as authorized by Section 1-1-1 et seq. of Chapter 24, Cities and Villages, as amended,
being the Municipal Code 1961, as amended, and other relevant provisions of the Illinois Revised Statutes, 1987, as amended.
SECTION II. Code Adopted. The Lake Zurich Municipal Code as appended hereto is hereby authorized, approved and adopted as the Official Village
Code of the Village of Lake Zurich, Lake County, Illinois, all upon the terms, provisions, limitations and conditions as set forth in said Lake Zurich Municipal
Code.
SECTION III. Ordinance Number; Effective Date. This ordinance shall be designated Ordinance No. 89-04-311 and shall be in full force and effect ten days
after its passage, approval and publication in pamphlet form.
The foregoing ordinance was passed by a vote as follows:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=373 22/524
Title 1
ADMINISTRATIVE
Chapter 1
OFFICIAL VILLAGE CODE
1-1-1: TITLE:
Upon the adoption by the Board of Trustees, this Village Code is hereby declared to be and shall hereafter constitute the Official Code of the Village. This
Village Code of Ordinances shall be known and cited as the LAKE ZURICH MUNICIPAL CODE or the MUNICIPAL CODE and it is hereby published by
authority of the Board of Trustees. Any reference to the number of any section contained herein shall be understood to refer to the position of the same
number, its appropriate chapter and title heading, and to the general penalty clause relating thereto, as well as to the section itself, when reference is
made to this Municipal Code by title in any legal document.
1-1-2: ACCEPTANCE:
The Municipal Code, as hereby presented in printed form, shall hereafter be received without further proof in all courts and in all administrative tribunals of
this State as the ordinances of the Village of Lake Zurich of general and permanent effect, except the excluded ordinances enumerated in Section 1-2-1 of
this Code.
1-1-3: AMENDMENTS:
Any ordinance amending the Municipal Code shall set forth the title, chapter and section number of the section or sections to be amended, and this shall
constitute sufficient compliance with any statutory requirement pertaining to the amendment or revision by ordinance of any part of this Municipal Code.
1-1-4: CODE ALTERATIONS:
It shall be deemed unlawful for any person to alter, change, replace or deface in any way any section or any page of this Municipal Code in such a manner
that the meaning of any phrase or order may be changed or omitted. Replacement pages may be inserted according to the official instructions when so
authorized by the Village Board. The Village Clerk shall see that the replacement pages are properly inserted in the officialcopies maintained in the office
of the Clerk. Any person having in his custody an official copy of the Municipal Code shall make every effort to maintain said Code in an up-to-date and
efficient manner. He shall see to the immediate insertion of new or replacement pages when such are delivered to him or made available to him through
the office of the Village Clerk. Said Municipal Code books, while in actual possession of officials and other interested persons, shall be and remain the
property of the Village and shall be returned to the office of the Clerk when directed to do so by order of the Village Board.
1-1-5: JURISDICTION:
Unless otherwise provided in this Municipal Code, this Municipal Code applies to acts performed within the corporate limits of the Village. Provisions of this
Municipal Code also apply to acts performed outside the corporate limits and up to the limits prescribed by law where the law confers power on the Village
to regulate such particular acts outside the corporate limits.
Chapter 2
SAVING CLAUSE
1-2-1: REPEAL OF GENERAL ORDINANCES:
All general ordinances of the Village passed prior to the adoption of this Municipal Code are hereby repealed, except such as are included in this Municipal
Code or are by necessary implication herein reserved from repeal (subject to the saving clauses contained in the following sections), and excluding the
following ordinances which are not hereby repealed: tax levy ordinances; appropriation ordinances; ordinances relating to boundaries and annexations;
franchise ordinances and other ordinances granting special rights to persons or corporations; contract ordinances and ordinances authorizing the
execution of a contract or the issuance of warrants, notes or bonds; salary ordinances; ordinances relating to the establishment, dedication, opening,
grade, naming, improvement, altering, widening or vacating of any streets, alleys, sidewalks, parks or public grounds; improvement ordinances; bond
ordinances; ordinances relating to elections; ordinances relating to the transfer or acceptance of real estate by or from the Village; ordinances regulating
subject matters reserved from enactment in this Municipal Code; and all special ordinances not in conflict with the provisions of this Municipal Code.
No ordinance or part of any ordinance heretofore repealed shall be considered reordained or re-enacted by virtue of this Municipal Code, unless
specifically re-enacted. The repeal of any curative or validating ordinance does not impair or affect any cure or validation already effected thereby.
1-2-2: PUBLIC UTILITY ORDINANCES:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=373 23/524
No ordinance relating to railroad crossings with streets and other public ways, or relating to the conduct, duties, service or rates of public utilities shall be
repealed by virtue of the adoption of this Municipal Code or by virtue of the preceding Section, excepting as the Municipal Code may contain provisions for
such matters; in which case, this Municipal Code shall be considered as amending such ordinance or ordinances in respect to such provisions only.
1-2-3: COURT PROCEEDINGS:
No new ordinance shall be construed or held to repeal a former ordinance whether such former ordinance is expressly repealed or not, as to any offense
committed against such former ordinance or as to any act done, any penalty, forfeiture or punishment so incurred, or any right accrued or claim arising
under the former ordinance, or in any way whatever to affect any such offense or act so committed or so done, or any penalty, forfeiture or punishment so
incurred or any right accrued or claim arising before the new ordinance takes effect, save only that the proceedings thereafter shall conform to the
ordinance in force at the time of such proceeding, so far as practicable. If any penalty, forfeiture or punishment be mitigated by any provision of a new
ordinance, such provision may be, by consent of the party affected, applied to any judgment announced after the new ordinance takes effect.
This Section shall extend to all repeals, either by express words or implication, whether the repeal is in the ordinance making any new provisions upon the
same subject or in any other ordinance.
Nothing contained in this Chapter shall be construed as abating any action now pending under or by virtue of any general ordinance of the Village herein
repealed and the provisions of all general ordinances contained in this Municipal Code shall be deemed to be continuing provisions and not a new
enactment of the same provision; nor shall this Chapter be deemed as discontinuing, abating, modifying or altering any penalty accrued or to accrue, or as
affecting the liability of any person, firm or corporation, or as waiving any right of the Village under any ordinance or provision thereof in force at the time of
the adoption of this Municipal Code.
1-2-4: SEVERABILITY CLAUSE:
If any section, subsection, subdivision, paragraph, sentence, clause or phrase of this Municipal Code or any part thereof is for any reason held to be
unconstitutional or invalid or ineffective by any court of competent jurisdiction, such decision shall not affect the validity or effectiveness of the remaining
portions of this Municipal Code, or any part thereof. The Village Board of Trustees hereby declares that it would have passed each section, subsection,
subdivision, paragraph, sentence, clause or phrase thereof irrespective of the fact that any one or more sections, subsections, subdivisions, paragraphs,
sentences, clauses or phrases be declared unconstitutional, invalid or ineffective by any court of competent jurisdiction. Such decision shall not affect the
validity or effectiveness of the remaining portions of this Municipal Code, or any part thereof.
Chapter 3
ADMINISTRATION OF CODE VIOLATIONS; GENERAL PENALTY
1-3-1: ADMINISTRATION OF CODE VIOLATIONS:
A. Authorized Officials, Processes: The Village Board of Trustees and the Village Manager and their appointed delegates including among others
representatives of the Lake Zurich Police Department, Building and Zoning Department, and Public Works Department have authority to administer and
enforce the provisions of this Code. Notwithstanding any provision of this Code to the contrary, a Code violation may be processed, heard, and
adjudicated by the Illinois Circuit Court for the Nineteenth Judicial Circuit (Lake County), or through the Village's administrative hearing system, or as
otherwise specifically provided in this Code or otherwise by law. In the case of any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this section and
any other provision of this Code, the provisions of this section will apply and control except as otherwise determined in writing by the Village Manager.
(Ord. 2010-02-697, 2-1-2010; amd. Ord. 2012-10-861, 10-1-2012)
B. Administrative Hearing System: If a violation of this Code is processed, heard, and adjudicated through the Village's administrative hearing system, then
chapter 8 of this title will apply and govern the processing, hearing, adjudication, and enforcement of that violation. (Ord. 2010-02-697, 2-1-2010)
1-3-2: GENERAL PENALTY:
A. General Penalty; Fines: Whenever the fine or penalty for a violation of this Code or any other code, ordinance, or regulation of the Village is not
specified, then that violation is punishable by a fine as shown in title 13, chapter 1, "Fee Schedule", of this Code. (Ord. 2010-02-697, 2-1-2010; amd.
Ord. 2018-12-279, 12-3-2018)
B. Separate Violation: A separate violation will be deemed to have been committed on each day on which a violation occurs or continues.
C. Imprisonment: The Village may seek imprisonment for a period not to exceed six (6) months for any violation in lieu of, or in addition to, any fine levied
under subsection A of this section, except that the Village may assess only those penalties set forth in subsection A of this section unless imprisonment
is specifically provided for in the citation, summons, or warrant or by other notice. (Ord. 2010-02-697, 2-1-2010)
1-3-3: APPLICATION OF PROVISIONS:
The administration of violations under section 1-3-1 of this chapter and the general penalty provided in section 1-3-2 of this chapter are applicable to every
section of this Code the same as though they were a part of each and every separate section. Any person convicted of a violation of any section of this
Code when any duty is prescribed or obligation imposed, or when any action that is of a continuing nature is forbidden or is declared to be unlawful, will be
deemed guilty of a misdemeanor. A separate offense will be deemed committed on each day such duty or obligation remains unperformed or such act
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=373 24/524
continues unless otherwise specifically provided in this Code.
The administration of violations under section 1-3-1 of this chapter and the general penalty provided in section 1-3-2 of this chapter apply to the
amendment of any section of this Code and to any code adopted herein by reference, regardless of whether that penalty is reenacted in the amendatory
ordinance.
A reference to a section of this Code is deemed also to refer to and include the administration of Code violations and the penalty section relating thereto,
unless otherwise expressly provided.
In all cases when the same offense is made punishable or is created by different clauses or sections of this Code, the prosecuting officer may elect under
which to proceed, but not more than one recovery may be had against the same person for the same offense. For purposes of this regulation, the
revocation of a license or permit will not be considered a recovery or penalty so as to bar any other penalty being enforced.
Whenever the doing of any act or the omission to do any act constitutes a breach of any section or provision of this code and no fine or penalty is
specifically declared for that breach, the provisions of this chapter will apply.
Every person concerned in the commission of an act prohibited by this code, whether one directly commits the act, or prosecutes, counsels, aids or abets
in its commission, may be prosecuted and on conviction is punishable as if he had directly committed such act. (Ord. 2010-02-697, 2-1-2010)
1-3-4: NO LIABILITY OF OFFICERS:
No provision of this code designating the duties of any officer or employee will be so construed as to make such officer or employee liable for any fine or
penalty provided for a failure to perform such duty, unless the intention of the board of trustees to impose such fine or penalty on such officer or employee
is specifically and clearly expressed in the section creating the duty. (Ord. 2010-02-697, 2-1-2010)
Chapter 4
VILLAGE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES
1-4-1: ELECTION; TERMS OF OFFICE; VACANCIES:
The village shall be governed by a board of trustees which shall be elected at large and shall consist of the village president and six (6) trustees.
The terms of office of the trustees shall be four (4) years and until their successors are elected and have qualified. After the first election, three (3) trustees
shall be elected by the electors of the village for a four (4) year term, as provided by statute.
The village president shall be elected by the electors of the village at a regular village election, as provided by statute. The village president's term of office
shall be four (4) years.
Vacancies in the offices of trustee or village president shall be filled as provided by Illinois law. (Ord. 2009-07-641, 7-6-2009)
1-4-2: SALARIES:
The village president shall receive a salary of nine thousand five hundred dollars ($9,500.00) per year. The village president also shall receive a salary of
five hundred dollars ($500.00) per year for serving as the Lake Zurich liquor control commissioner. These salaries shall be paid in accordance with the
village's regular payroll procedures. Trustees of the village shall be paid a salary of three thousand dollars ($3,000.00) per year, payable in accordance
with the village's regular payroll procedures. (Ord. 2009-07-641, 7-6-2009)
1-4-3: VILLAGE PRESIDENT:
A. Powers And Duties:
1. President Of Board: The village president shall be president of the board of trustees as provided by Illinois law. The village president may be referred
to as mayor of the village.
2. Supervisory Powers: The village president shall be the chief executive officer of the village and shall perform all such duties as may be required by
Illinois law or local ordinance. The village president shall have general supervision over all the executive officers of the village and over all of the
employees of the village. The village president shall have the power and authority to inspect at any reasonable time all books and records kept by
any village officer, employee, or agent.
3. Designations Of Duties1: The village president shall settle any question as to the respective powers or duties of any appointed officer or employee of
the village. The village president shall have the power to delegate to any such officer any duty that is to be performed when no specific officer has
been directed to perform the duty.
4. Appointments Of Officers: The village president shall appoint, by and with the advice and consent of the board of trustees, all officers whose
appointment which by law or ordinance the village president is empowered to fill, and whenever a vacancy occurs in any office, which by law or
ordinance the village president is empowered to fill, the village president shall, within thirty (30) days after the happening of such vacancy,
communicate to the board of trustees the name of the appointee to such office, and pending the concurrence of the board of trustees in such
appointment, the village president may designate some suitable person to discharge the functions of such office.
5. Removal Of Officers: The village president shall have the power to remove any officer appointed by the village president on any formal charge
whenever the village president determines that the interests of the village demand such removal. The village president's power to remove an officer
shall be exercised in accordance with Illinois law. The village president shall report the reasons for such removal to the board of trustees at a meeting
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=373 25/524
to be held not less than five (5) days nor more than ten (10) days after such removal. If the village president fails or refuses to file with the clerk a
statement of the reasons for such removal, or if the board of trustees by a two-thirds (2/3) vote of all its members authorized by law to be elected, by
"yeas" and "nays" to be entered upon its record, disapproves of such removal, then such officer shall thereupon become restored to the office from
which the officer was removed, but the officer shall give a new bond and take a new oath of office. No officer shall be removed a second time for the
same offense.
6. Signature Required: The village president shall sign all village warrants, commissions, permits, and licenses granted by authority of the board of
trustees, except as otherwise provided, and such other documents as law or ordinance may require.
7. Peace Officer: The village president may exercise within the village limits the powers conferred upon sheriffs by law to suppress disorder and keep
the peace.
B. President Pro Tem: During the temporary absence or disability of the village president, the board of trustees shall elect one of its number to act as
president pro tem who, during the absence or disability of the village president, shall perform the duties of the office, in accordance with Illinois law.
(Ord. 2009-07-641, 7-6-2009)
1-4-4: MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES:
A. Regular Meetings: The board of trustees shall hold its regular meetings at the village hall on the first and third Mondays of each month at seven o'clock
(7:00) P.M., except when such date falls on a legal holiday, in which event the meeting shall be held on the next succeeding business day. The board of
trustees may change the date, place, or time of any meeting by proper notice in accordance with Illinois law.
B. Special Meetings: The village president or any three (3) of the trustees may call special meetings of the board of trustees at any time. Notice of each
special meeting shall be given by the village in accordance with the Illinois open meetings act. The clerk shall promptly notify all members of the board
of trustees of any special meeting by delivering a written notice stating the time and place of such meeting to each member personally or by leaving the
notice at the member's residence2.
Whenever all of the members of the board of trustees are present at any special meeting, the requirement of notice of such special meeting shall be
deemed waived. (Ord. 2009-07-641, 7-6-2009)
1-4-5: LACK OF QUORUM:
If for any reason a quorum of the board of trustees is not present at any meeting of the board of trustees, then those members present at the meeting shall
adjourn the meeting. (Ord. 2009-07-641, 7-6-2009)
1-4-6: CONTENT, ORDER OF AGENDA; CONSENT AGENDA; RULES OF PROCEDURE:
A. Content And Order Of Agenda: For regular meetings, the board of trustees may establish, from time to time, the categories of agenda matters and the
order in which the categories appear on the agenda. The board of trustees, by motion and a majority vote, may change the categories, order, and
content of the agenda for a particular meeting, in accordance with the Illinois open meetings act. The agenda for a regular meeting of the board of
trustees generally shall include, among other items determined by the board of trustees: 1) call to order; 2) roll call; 3) approval of minutes from
previous meetings of the board of trustees; 4) public comments; 5) consent agenda; 6) old or continuing business; 7) new business; and 8)
adjournment. (Ord. 2012-07-846, 7-16-2012)
B. Consent Agenda: The village manager, in his or her discretion, may include on the consent agenda, among other items: 1) all matters on which a
preliminary vote or recommendation has been taken by the board of trustees, subject to the drafting of an ordinance or resolution; 2) approval of
meeting minutes, resolutions, ordinances or motions; 3) acceptance of plats of subdivision; and 4) all other matters deemed by the manager as routine
or noncontroversial and appropriate for a consent agenda. The consent agenda shall be adopted and approved by a roll call vote and the roll call shall
be recorded in the minutes of the board of trustees along with the words "Consent Agenda". The motion to adopt the consent agenda shall be
nondebatable. Any item may be removed from the consent agenda at the board of trustees' meeting at the request of any one trustee or village
president, in which case the item shall be considered separately immediately following the consent agenda vote. The taking of a single vote on the
consent agenda shall be deemed sufficient compliance with all requirements of law, as if the vote had been taken separately by nays and ayes on the
question of each ordinance, resolution and motion included on the consent agenda. In the event one or more trustees wishes to be recorded as
passing or voting against any item included in the consent agenda, that trustee, immediately following the vote, shall so notify the village clerk who will
make an appropriate reference in the minutes to record such negative votes. (Ord. 2012-07-846, 7-16-2012; amd. Ord. 2012-10-861, 10-1-2012)
C. Rules Of Procedure: In matters not specified below and in general, the board of trustees shall apply "Robert's Rules Of Order" to guide the board of
trustees' legislative proceedings. The following specific rules shall guide meetings of the board of trustees:
1. Speaking On The Question: No member shall speak more than twice on the same question without unanimous consent of the board of trustees, nor
more than once until every member wishing to speak shall have spoken. Speeches on all questions shall be limited to ten (10) minutes.
2. Voting: Every member present when a question is taken shall vote unless excused by the board of trustees or unless the member may be directly
interested in the question, in which case, the member shall not vote. Every motion shall be reduced to writing if the village president or any member
desires it.
3. Question To Be Stated: Every question or motion when seconded shall be stated by the village president distinctly before it is open for debate.
4. Votes To Be Recorded: If any member requires it, the ayes and nays upon any question shall be taken and entered on the minutes.
5. Motion To Lay On Table: A motion to lay on the table simply shall not be debatable, but a motion to lay on the table with any condition shall be
subject to amendment and debate.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=373 26/524
6. Clerk To Forward Papers: The clerk shall forward all papers to the appropriate committee and officers as early as the third business day after the
reference shall have been made.
7. Ordinances: Except where otherwise required by law, ordinances need not be read in their entirety prior to action by the board of trustees and may
be enacted at the same meeting at which they are introduced.
8. Written Communications: Written communications received by the village need not be read in full, but the clerk may report the substance thereof to
the board of trustees and, thereafter, the village president may refer the communication to the appropriate committee; provided, however, that any
such communication shall be read in full and separately acted upon by the board of trustees if so requested by the village president or any member
of the board of trustees.
9. Addressing The Board: Except during the public comment portion of the meeting, no person not a member of the board of trustees, except village
officials and employees, shall have the privilege of addressing the board of trustees without the consent of two-thirds (2/3) of all members present.
10. Suspension Of Rules: These rules of procedure may be suspended by concurrence of two-thirds (2/3) of all members of the board of trustees. (Ord.
2009-07-641, 7-6-2009; amd. Ord. 2012-07-846, 7-16-2012)
1-4-7: COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE; SPECIAL COMMITTEES; TASK FORCES:
A. Committee Of The Whole:
1. Creation Of Committee: The committee of the whole of the board of trustees is hereby created as a standing committee of the board of trustees.
2. Meetings: The village president or any three (3) of the trustees may call a meeting of the committee of the whole at any time. Notice of each
committee of the whole meeting shall be given by the village in accordance with the Illinois open meetings act. The clerk shall promptly notify all
members of the board of trustees of a meeting of the committee of the whole by delivering a written notice stating the time and place of such meeting
to each member personally or by leaving the notice at the member's residence.
3. Membership; Chairperson: The committee of the whole is composed of the seven (7) members of the board of trustees. The village president is the
chairperson of the committee of the whole. In the absence of the village president from a meeting of the committee of the whole, the members of the
committee of the whole present at that meeting shall elect from among themselves a person to serve as chairperson for that meeting.
4. Meetings; Procedures: All meetings of the committee of the whole must be conducted in compliance with the requirements of the Illinois open
meetings act. The procedures governing meetings of the committee of the whole generally shall be the same as the procedures applicable to
meetings of the board of trustees.
B. Special Committees: Special committees of the board of trustees may be designated as provided in this subsection. A special committee must be
composed exclusively of members of the board of trustees.
1. Designation: The village president by appointment or the board of trustees by motion, resolution, or ordinance duly adopted may designate and
establish special committees of the board of trustees as the president or board of trustees deem advisable from time to time. The membership of a
special committee of the board appointed by the village president is subject to the advice and consent of the board of trustees. When a special
committee of the board is established, the appointing authority, being either the village president or the board of trustees, must set forth the
membership of that committee, the purposes and duties of that committee, and the term of that committee and its members.
2. Meetings; Procedures: Meetings of a special committee must be conducted in compliance with the requirements of the Illinois open meetings act.
The procedures governing meetings of a special committee generally shall be the same as the procedures applicable to meetings of the board of
trustees.
C. Committees Are Advisory Only: The committee of the whole and special committees of the board of trustees are advisory to the board of trustees only
and have no power to take final action on any matter.
D. Task Forces: The village president may appoint a task force from time to time to advise the village president on village policies and issues. Task forces
will not be advisory to the board of trustees, any other board or commission of the village, or employee of the village; will not have authority to act in
any way for or on behalf of the village; and will not be a board, commission, committee, or other subsidiary body of the village. Members of a task force
may not accept any monetary compensation or gratuity from the village. The village president must advise the board of trustees of the creation of any
task force, the purpose of that task force, and the membership of that task force. (Ord. 2009-10-658, 10-5-2009)
1-4-8: LEGAL COUNSEL TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES:
The board of trustees, by resolution, may appoint an attorney or firm of attorneys as legal counsel to the board of trustees. Such legal counsel shall attend
board of trustees' meetings at the request of the village president or any three (3) trustees and, upon request at a meeting of the board of trustees or at
any other time, shall provide legal advice relative to village ordinances, resolutions, motions or any other village matters, to the village president, or to the
board of trustees, or to any committee of the board, or to any trustee. In addition, such legal counsel shall provide legal advice relative to village matters to
any staff persons of the village upon request of the village manager, the village president, or any trustee, and to the village president upon his or her
request. The trustees shall designate a convenient location at meetings of the board of trustees where such legal counsel shall be seated. Such legal
counsel shall not be an officer of the village and shall serve at the pleasure of the board of trustees. (Ord. 2009-07-641, 7-6-2009; amd. Ord. 2012-10-861,
10-1-2012)
Chapter 5
VILLAGE CLERK
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=373 27/524
1-5-1: ELECTION AND TERM:
The village clerk shall be elected and serve for a four (4) year term and until a successor is elected and qualified, as provided by statute1. (1989 Code)
1-5-2: OATH AND BOND:
The clerk, before entering upon the duties of office, shall take the oath of office prescribed by law, and shall execute a bond to the village as provided in
subsection 1-6-4B of this title, with sureties as shall be approved by the president and board of trustees, conditioned for the faithful performance of the
duties of the office and the payment of all monies that may be received by the clerk according to law and ordinance. The bond shall be filed with the
treasurer. (1989 Code)
1-5-3: DUTIES:
The clerk shall:
A. Minutes, Notices: Attend all meetings of the board of trustees and keep in a suitable book a full and faithful record of its proceedings. The clerk shall
issue and cause to be served upon all trustees notices of all special meetings of the board2, also notices to the members of the different committees of
the board and to all other persons whose attendance may be required before any such committee when so directed by the chairman thereof.
B. Custody Of Seal And Records: Be the keeper and custodian of the corporate seal of the village. The clerk shall carefully preserve all books, records,
papers, maps and effects of every description belonging to the village or pertaining to the clerk's office and not in actual use and possession of other
village officers. Upon the expiration of an official term, the clerk shall deliver all such records, books, papers and effects to the successor in office.
C. Record Of Ordinances: Record and properly index in a book kept for that purpose all ordinances passed by the board within five (5) days after passage
and approval by the president, and at the foot of each ordinance so recorded, the clerk shall make a memorandum showing dates of passage3.
D. Preparation Of Documents: Prepare all commissions, licenses, permits and other official documents required to be issued by the clerk under the laws
and ordinances of the village and shall attest the same with the corporate seal and shall in like manner attest all deeds for the sale or transfer of real
estate owned by the village and all bonds issued by the village.
E. Record Of Licenses: Number in numerical order all licenses made out by the clerk and before delivery thereof, shall register them in like order in a book
kept for that purpose, giving number, date, period of time for which issued, to whom issued, for what purpose, fee and definite location of business of
licensee. The clerk shall also on May 1 of each year, prepare and mail notices for renewal of licenses and payment of fees to the village to all persons
engaged in or carrying on a business or occupation required to be licensed by this code4.
F. Other Duties: In addition to the duties set forth in this section, perform all other duties pertaining to the office as are and may be imposed upon the clerk
by law or resolution of the board of trustees. (1989 Code)
1-5-4: OFFICES OF CLERK AND COLLECTOR:
The village clerk shall not hold the office of village collector. (1989 Code)
1-5-5: OFFICE:
The clerk shall keep office in the village hall or at such other place as the board of trustees may direct. (1989 Code)
1-5-6: SALARY:
The salary for the village clerk shall be four thousand eight hundred dollars ($4,800.00) per year. The village clerk's salary may be adjusted, from time to
time, by the president and board of trustees, subject to the limitations set on increases or decreases in salaries of elected officers by the Illinois
constitution, article 3 of the Illinois municipal code, and other applicable law. (Ord. 2006-10-455, 10-16-2006, eff. 5-1-2009)
1-5-7: DEPUTY CLERK:
A. Appointment: There is hereby created in and for the village the office of deputy clerk who shall have the power and duty to execute all documents
required by any law to be executed by the village clerk and to affix the seal of the village clerk thereto whenever required. The appointment of such
deputy clerk shall serve at the pleasure of the village clerk and shall be a permanent, full time employee of the village at the time of and for the duration
of appointment.
B. Signature On Documents: In signing any such document the deputy clerk shall sign the name of the village clerk followed with the word "by" and the
deputy clerk's own name and the words "deputy clerk". (Ord. 2013-06-895, 6-17-2013)
